summary: 'One Fast Move' is streaming Aug. 8 on Prime Video
author: Jen Juneau
title: KJ Apa and Eric Dane Rev Up in Thrilling One Fast Move Trailer (Exclusive)
text: KJ Apa is a man on the move in his newest role. PEOPLE has an exclusive first look at the trailer for the Riverdale alum's R-rated action-adventure film One Fast Move. In it, he plays Wes, "a young man down on his luck who seeks out his estranged father (Eric Dane) to help him pursue his dream of becoming a professional motorcycle racer." "With the help of his small-town love interest and a motorcycle-shop owner who moonlights as his mentor, he begins to break down the walls that his father’s absence had built up," the synopsis adds. At the start of the trailer, Wes (Apa, 27) is seen being released from prison and facing a tough transition back into life and employment, before connecting with his estranged dad, Dean (Dane, 51). Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer, from juicy celebrity news to compelling human-interest stories. After clearing some seemingly awkward hurdles regarding Dean's relationship with his mother, Wes is shown learning about the art of racing under the tutelage of his father. "Hey, look at that, I taught him that outside pass!" Dean proudly proclaims at one point as he watches his son in action. "The faster I go, the calmer I feel," Wes says near the end of the trailer. "So you just need to keep going faster," Dean replies. Speaking with Entertainment Weekly, director Kelly Blatz said One Fast Move "was inspired by my love for classic, exhilarating sports dramas like The Fighter, Ford v. Ferrari and Rocky." "As a devoted motorcycle enthusiast, I couldn't help but notice the absence of a film centered around the thrilling sport of motorcycle racing," he continued. "With One Fast Move, my team and I dedicated ourselves to creating an authentic film that captures the excitement and danger of motorcycle racing, while also delivering a compelling, character-driven drama." Both directed and written by Blatz, 37, the film also stars Edward James Olmos and Maia Reficco, and is distributed by Amazon MGM Studios. One Fast Move is streaming Aug. 8 on Prime Video.

summary: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban said he would go to Washington after discussing a Chinese peace plan for Ukraine in Beijing. Hungary began its six-month EU presidency in July.
author: Reuters
title: Hungarian PM Viktor Orban visits Washington after meeting with China's Xi Jinping
text: Hungary's Prime Minister Viktor Orban said on Monday he would go to Washington after discussing a Chinese peace plan for Ukraine in Beijing. Hungary began its six-month EU presidency in July with a call to "Make Europe Great Again", echoing former U.S. President Donald Trump, an Orban ally and sharp critic of the EU. Since then, Orban has visited Kyiv, Moscow and Beijing in what he calls a "peace mission" for the war in Ukraine. PUTIN STRESSES PEACE ONLY AFTER UKRAINE'S SURRENDER AS HUNGARY'S ORBAN MAKES SURPRISE VISIT TO MOSCOW His most recent trip to China came days ahead of a NATO summit that will address providing further support to Ukraine and follows the European Commission confirming last week that it will impose tariffs on imports of electric vehicles made in China. Nationalist Orban, who is backing Trump's bid to return to the White House, met him in Florida in March, but there is no indication yet that they will meet again. CLICK HERE TO GET THE FOX NEWS APP The Hungarian government did not immediately reply to questions sent regarding details of his visit to the United States, which he announced on his social media account. Orban has refused to send weapons to Kyiv and kept up close economic ties with Moscow since Russian forces invaded Ukraine in 2022. He met Russian President Vladimir Putin last Friday.

summary: The actor shared his career regrets in a recent podcast interview
author: Escher Walcott
title: John Corbett Says 'It’s Been Unfulfilling’ as an Actor in Hollywood: 'Wrong Thing to Do with My Life’
text: John Corbett would have done things differently in his career looking back. The actor, 63, said it's been “unfulfilling” being a TV actor and that he chose the “wrong” career path in a recent interview on the Fly on the Wall with Dana Carvey and David Spade podcast. “Look, I’m in the fourth quarter of the football game now, in life and in showbiz. It’s just a fact. So I can reveal now I picked the f------ wrong thing to do with my life,” Corbett said. “I’ve made a lot of money. I live in a beautiful home. People come to me at every restaurant I go in. I’m a friend of the world,” the actor continued. “But as far as a fulfilling creative work life, I didn’t write one f------ line. I didn’t write one joke to make people laugh. So it’s been unfulfilling on that level.” Corbett mentioned Emma Stone as someone he admires as an actor who is also involved in the creative process of putting a project together, after producing the films Poor Things and Kinds of Kindness, in collaboration with director Yorgos Lanthimos. “I’m not collaborating with the writers,” Corbett explained. “... Have you ever sat in a waiting room of a doctor’s office for like an hour and been like, ‘What the f---?’ For me, that’s what making a movie is like, because I’m not part of any creative process.” “I’m not a movie actor … I’m really a television actor and so that has to move quick and that guy’s got to make a million decisions. And we’re not shucking and jiving and going out for wine after,” he added. “And so I’m just at this point in my life … if something seems really, really fun, I’ll say yes.” Corbett’s comments come after his appearance in season two of And Just Like That... in which he reprised his role as Carrie Bradshaw’s love interest Aidan Shaw from the Sex and the City TV series in 2023. During the season, Aidan and Carrie (played by Sarah Jessica Parker) got back together and moved into a new home in New York following Aidan's divorce. The couple’s romance was put in jeopardy, however, by the finale episode as Shaw needed to leave the city for at least five years to tend to his youngest son, Wyatt. In May, Corbett was photographed back on set filming scenes with Parker, 59, in New York City for season three of the show. Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer​​, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories. Season 3 of And Just Like That... is slated to premiere on HBO in 2025.

summary: The Public Enemy veteran and official hypeman for the Olympic women’s water-polo team talks going back to high school, Taylor Swift, and why he still loves performing his “old-ass songs”
author: Jason Newman
title: Flavor Flav Has Many Thoughts on Water Polo
text: It makes zero sense and all the sense in the world why Flavor Flav and I have spent the past hour grabbing lunch at New York’s Harvard Club. Built in the 1890s, the stately private social club in midtown Manhattan boasts an elegant dining room with chandeliers, ornate silverware, and for one day, a 65-year-old hip-hop icon wearing sparkly pants, an Olympic women’s water-polo team T-shirt and a Team USA clock dangling from his neck. Like any other place, the Public Enemy hypeman both sticks out and is gleefully welcomed by all. (“Fix your shit,” one employee is overheard saying to another. “Flav’s almost here.”) Throughout his career — but especially in recent years — Flavor Flav has become music’s de facto good vibes ambassador, posting heartfelt Instagram videos of meeting other musicians (“Woooooooooooow,” he says to a smiling Bruce Springsteen while bowing) and doing absurd shit like trying to save Red Lobster from bankruptcy. (The seafood chain thanked him with his own signature meal.) So when Flavor Flav responded to Olympic water-polo gold medalist Maggie Steffans’ Instagram post in May with “AYYY YOOO,,, as a girl dad and supporter of all women’s sports – imma personally sponsor you my girl, whatever you need. And imma sponsor the whole team …. That’s a FLAVOR FLAV promise,” it was unclear how serious he meant it. Very serious, it turns out. As the team’s official hypeman, he’s been promoting the team at every opportunity ever since. Later this month, he’ll be on a flight to Paris supporting them in their quest for a fourth consecutive gold medal. “If everything goes well, I’ll be doing this for the next five years into the next Olympics,” he tells Rolling Stone over a barely touched minestrone soup. “I might even do it for another five.” Four decades into his career, Flav may be more famous and busier now than he’s ever been. Public Enemy continue to tour 37 years after their debut album. A Flavor Flav solo R&B album is in the works, as is a reality show where he goes back to high school to get his diploma. In a wide-ranging discussion, hip-hop’s most famous hypeman waxes about water polo, being “King Swiftie,” and why he wants to make everyone he meets “feel like they’re on top of the world.” Let’s start with the obvious: How does Flavor Flav become the official hypeman for the U.S. Olympic women’s water-polo team?My manager ran across Maggie’s post and said, “Flav, this wouldn’t be a bad idea to help these guys out.” Then I read the post and was like, “Man, I would be honored, and I would love to help.” It’s my first time ever doing something like this. One thing about Flavor Flav: He’s always known to be the first to do something and then everybody follows my train after. So hopefully, I might be opening the doors to where other celebs will come out and sponsor some of these Olympic teams. Because nobody’s doing it; not even the government, which is messed up. I said, “You know what? I’m gonna step up to the plate and give these girls some help.” These girls won three Olympic gold medals doing this hard-ass sport, but they’re not really getting the recognition. A lot of people ain’t really paying attention, and I’d love to see the sport grow. What does it mean specifically to be a water-polo hypeman? What are your goals for the team?My goal is to drive them further to want to do better, feel more comfortable, and get more gold medals. I also want to make sure that these women feel like they’re important and like somebody’s got their back. When you feel like somebody’s got your back, it makes you want to do even better.It’s a side of you most people haven’t seen.Well, let me say this: The reason why a lot of people really haven’t been seeing that side of me is because they been seeing me in a totally different light. Either they see me onstage performing music or they see me on reality-TV shows. But my personal life? Yes, it portrays this part of me. I’ve always been a supporter of women because I respect women a lot. I think a lot of women need more respect than men. I don’t mind being one of the first to show it. If there’s a certain way of life that you would love to see people live, then it wouldn’t be bad for you to try to project that first. Show the example.Were you a fan of the Olympics growing up?Always. Growing up watching [gold medalist figure skater] Peggy Fleming. Nobody did it better than [gold medalist swimmer] Marc Spitz. The great Olga Korbut from way back in the days. And, um, what’s my girl’s name? Nadia Comăneci. One of my favorite historical moments watching on TV was Muhammad Ali lighting the Olympic torch [in 1996]. And one day, hopefully, I’ll get to do it. What’s crazy now is that two of Muhammad Ali’s grandkids ended up being my godchildren. Did you two ever cross paths?I met him two years before he passed away. [His daughter] Rashida is a friend of the family and called me and said, “Hey, Flav, Daddy’s here!” I ran down the street and everything to get some pictures. It was a sentimental moment. On his last birthday, they videotaped him with me on FaceTime singing “911 Is a Joke” to him. You’ve been recognized globally for so long. Do you remember the first time you felt famous?It’s difficult for me to answer because it never crossed my mind. Everything just happened, and I just gradually took it in and just lived it. But I think I knew the first time when we were invited to the Soul Train Music Awards to give an award to Michael Jackson [in the 1980s]. I showed my ass off that day. [Soul Train creator] Don Cornelius did not like me; he was not accepting of me because he’s never seen that type of behavior before. I met Don backstage and he said, “Look, brother. That shit you pulled out there was fucked up.” I was a big fan, and he just broke me down. The following year, we were invited back again, and we gave out another award. I saw Don backstage and he said, “Brother, listen. I really tried my best, brother, to keep you off my show. My producers would not let it happen. I don’t know what it is about you.” I read somewhere there’s a reality show in the works about getting your high school diploma. What’s the latest on that?I dropped out in the 10th grade, so I’ve got a real big degree in street education. What made me drop out was me being a Dennis the Menace getting in a lot of trouble, getting locked up, going in and out of jail all the time. Next thing you know, I just ended up not going back to school after the last time that I went to jail. I was in gangs, and I used to be a follower more than a leader. As a little kid, you want to be the one in the neighborhood that everybody’s talking about. And some of those people that I wanted to be like weren’t the right people. Anybody fuck with me, I would beat they ass. If anybody tried to fight me back, they would get fucked up.So what made you decide to get your diploma now at age 65?I always wanted to make my mom happy, and she would have been happy if I would have graduated from high school. So my mom passed away, but to me, the body is nothing but a shell that goes in the ground. We still stay here; it’s just the shell that went in the ground. So my mom is right here right now with us while I’m doing this interview with you. Plus, I really want it. My two older sisters got theirs, and I want to complete the family with education. I’m more focused now. I’m not living with distractions. We gettin’ ready to go into production this year. We’re just trying to find a school for me to join. Is it actually you in a high school desk with the rest of the students?I’m going to regular school every single day. Every day, I wanna go to school and sit in class and learn and take tests like all the other kids. A regular school year is like nine months.Man, listen. Whatever it takes to get my diploma. I don’t want a GED. I want a di-plo-ma. The real shit. I’m doing the program to show people my age that it’s never too late to go back and get your diploma, but it’s also to influence all of the kids that are in school right now to get that piece of paper because you’re gonna have a hard time in life without it. Staying on TV, any thoughts on a Flavor of Love Season Four?[Looks at girlfriend next to him.] No. I been there and done that. With dating shows, I set the tone for reality television already. I’ve got a good fucking woman. I’m not losing what I got. [Picks up recorder.] Fuck. That. I’m putting the anchor around her ankles. She ain’t goin’ no place. Social media can obviously be deceiving, but optically it looks like you’re having one of the best times of your life right now.I’m having a real good time in my life. This time right now is a little more exciting ’cause I’m getting to meet some of my favorite people that I’ve never met before. Meeting Cher was so huge to me. Bruce Springsteen was so huge to me. Me learning about Taylor Swift and becoming one of her biggest supporters was huge to me. The Flav-Taylor friendship has been one of the more-endearing stories in music.Man, when I went to her show in Detroit, her fanbase came up to me and embraced me. I had friendship bracelets on both arms. I didn’t really know too much about Taylor Swift — my girlfriend’s daughter wanted to see her — and didn’t know it was going to be all of what it ended up to be. Then I went home and listened to some of her lyrics. My favorite song and the one that really made me understand her the most was “Bad Blood.” This girl writes about all the actual life experiences she goes through.When I looked at the lyrics, it’s true shit: Me and you, man, we used to be cool, bro. You done fucked up! Our problems are so fucking bad, we can’t even solve them. That’s in a whole bunch of people’s lives. There will be times when people would read the lyrics and break down and analyze a Public Enemy record. I did the same thing with Taylor Swift and ever since then, I started supporting her. [At this point, a maître d’ for the Harvard Club sheepishly comes over. “I’m so sorry to bother you,” he says, ”but I just wanted to say ‘Welcome back to the club.’” Flav and him embrace.] It’s surreal thinking of her younger fans listening to Public Enemy. You’ve existed as a pop culture figure outside of PE for so long, does it almost feel like you’ve divorced Flavor Flav the performer from Flavor Flav the icon?Flavor Flav is a street character that I made based off of my real life in the streets. The same Flavor Flav that’s onstage with Public Enemy is the same Flavor Flav that’s offstage too. I remember one time I came home like, ”Yo, Ma, what’s going on?” She was like, ”Don’t you come in here with that Flavor Flav shit.” My mom wasn’t having it — she’s a church lady. But after a while, she got to understand Flavor Flav and started allowing it. I usually cut it off when I’m home with my kids. It’s been 37 years since Public Enemy’s first album. Is it harder to do shows now?Honestly, it’s easier, but I’m more anxious now than back then because what we did back in those days is missing from music and I want to put it back. I’m anxious to put it back. I’m anxious to lead the way again. When I’m onstage with my partner Chuck D, magic happens. A lot of veteran musicians have mixed feelings about performing songs they’ve played so much in the past. It doesn’t seem like you’re in that position.Fuck, no. I love doing all my old-ass songs. If it wasn’t for those old-ass songs, I wouldn’t be the new-ass me. I couldn’t be the new-ass me without all of the support from all of my old-ass fans. You take all my old-ass fans along with the new-ass fans to make the new-ass me.What do you hope your legacy is?That I tried to make a difference within the world. I have a personal goal: Inside of Flavor Flav, there’s not one, not one racist bone in my body. I’m against separatism. This world is made up of a whole bunch of different races of people. But everybody is so fucking separate and divided. No matter what race we come from, no matter what part of the world that we come from, no matter what religion we study, no matter what language we speak, at the end of the day, we’re all brothers and sisters, man. So my goal is to try to combine all the races of the world together as one and build a wall of unity. The only way that I can help make that happen is to speak about it now and hopefully other people will understand and listen to me and try to join me. That’s the only way that I can help make the world change, but I can’t do it by myself. But I can put the word out by myself. It also helps explain your interest in the Olympics. Exactly. And hopefully, there’ll be other celebrities that will follow my trend and help sponsor a lot of these teams that need help with sponsorship. I’m known for opening up new doors. You told CNN that “when we die, we become nothing but memories. But we wanna be the most positive memories, the most influential memories, the most innovative memories … that’s talked about years after our death.” Why is this so important to you?The purpose of me coming into this business is to put smiles on people’s faces and to give people good memories. When people support you, you should be grateful for that. And the person that supports you, you got to make them feel like they’re on top of the world. And so when that person leaves you, you want them to leave with a good feeling about you.That’s why when people come up to me and ask for a picture or a handshake or a hug, sometimes I don’t feel like being fucked with by nobody inside. But these people are the ones that supported me and made me who I am to society. So whatever I’m feeling inside, I gotta cut that shit off and give that fan what they want. Let them leave me with a smile on their face. Let them go home and brag to their families, “Hey, I met Flavor!” You give them good memories to take to their graves. You don’t want them to take bad memories of you to their grave. I want everybody to have a good feeling about me. I want everybody to have something positive to say about me. Even years after my death, I want people saying positive shit about me.

summary: Major deals on rarely discounted items? That's the beauty of the Nordstrom Anniversary Sale.
author: Hannah Southwick
title: Best Nordstrom Anniversary Sale beauty deals on celeb-loved skincare, more
text: Major deals on rarely discounted items? That’s the beauty of the Nordstrom Anniversary Sale. The highly anticipated shopping event kicks off today, offering deep discounts on even the most luxurious skincare and makeup must-haves. This year’s selection includes several exclusive beauty sets, featuring must-haves from the likes of Charlotte Tilbury, Augustinus Bader and 111Skin for less than you’ll find them anywhere else. Deals are already open to Nordstrom’s Icon cardholders; Ambassadors and Influencers can start shopping on July 9 and 10, respectively, before the sale opens everyone on July 15. Below, start stocking your cart with our curation of the best celebrity-loved beauty buys. Charlotte Tilbury Pillow Talk Lip Kit Charlotte Tilbury’s Pillow Talk lipstick is the talk of Hollywood. Meghan Markle wore the iconic pink-nude shade for a Time magazine cover shoot, while everyone from Gwyneth Paltrow to Olivia Culpo has swiped it on before red carpets. Augustinus Bader The Rich Cream Duo This much-hyped hydrator has a rich history in Hollywood; it once appeared on Jennifer Aniston’s “Morning Show” glam table in an Instagram Story snap, while Hailey Bieber told followers she’s gone through multiple bottles of the stuff. Nars Iconic Blush Duo Few blush shades have Hollywood tickled pink quite like Nars Orgasm. It’s reportedly Kim Kardashian’s go-to hue, while Meghan Markle raved about it in an interview during her “Suits” days. “I use it on and off camera because it gives you a nice glow from within,” she told Allure in 2017. Dolce Glow Lusso Self-Tanning Mousse Set Dolce Glow just might be the most celebrity-loved self-tanner brand on the market — no surprise considering founder and superstar spray tan artist Isabel Alysa’s clients include Kim Kardashian, Jennifer Lopez and Miley Cyrus (the latter of whom loves Dolce Glow so much, she even invested in the brand). The glow guru herself told Page Six Style the sunless tan functions like a “filter on your skin” to “help tone, reduce appearance of cellulite [and] blur imperfections” — which we found true when trying it out ourselves. MAC Pout Full of Posies Lip Kit Love that red lip classic thing Taylor Swift likes? The superstar’s favorite red lipsticks include MAC’s Ruby Woo, a blue-based red also beloved by the likes of Rihanna, Gwen Stefani, Janet Jackson and Angelina Jolie. “It’s a staple. I was the last person to discover it,” Swift told People in 2015. Discover the hot hue for yourself with this discounted kit featuring the signature lipstick, plus matching liner and gloss to complete the look. Slip Pure Silk Scrunchies 10-Pack These anti-breakage hair ties have certainly gotten their big break in Hollywood. The silk scrunchies have popped up on everyone from Taylor Swift to Reese Witherspoon to Kendall Jenner. Dr. Dennis Gross FaceWare Pro LED Light Therapy Device & Skincare Set Dr. Dennis Gross’ skincare company has racked up a long list of A-list fans. Lucy Hale and Rita Ora are reportedly fans of his LED mask, while Constance Wu once told the New York Times she uses the peel pads when she wants “to be really glow-y the next day.” Try both out for yourself in Nordstrom’s exclusive The Science of Glow Set ($254 $135). Jo Malone Wood Sage & Sea Salt Cologne Home & Away Set Wherever your summer travel plans take you, keep your favorite fragrance in tow thanks to this bundle, which features both full- and travel-sized versions. Sofia Richie dubbed the beachy blend her “signature” scent in an Instagram post with the brand, while Meghan Markle name-checked it in a 2016 interview. Sunday Riley Jumbo Good Genes All-in-One Lactic Acid Treatment Sunday Riley’s famous fans include Paige DeSorbo, Drew Barrymore and Oprah, the latter of whom featured this exfoliating serum on her 2018 “Favorite Things” list as part of her “go-to beauty regimen.” 111Skin Face Mask Discovery Set For a limited time only, this 111Skin set will run you far less than $111. While the British brand is rarely on sale, Nordstrom’s got a great price on a starter set of four celebrity-loved face masks — from the de-puffing one seen on Lady Gaga to the rose gold version Priyanka Chopra calls her “special sauce.” Charlotte Tilbury Airbrush Flawless Finish Setting Spray Duo Ready, set, save. To lock in your look, stock up on a duo of Charlotte Tilbury setting sprays — a formula trusted by Lana Del Rey, Ice Spice and Serena Williams. Supergoop! Unseen Sunscreen Jumbo + Go Set Christie Brinkley told us Supergoop! sunscreen is her “No. 1” go-to for turning back the clock — and right now, time is ticking to pick it up in this discounted set. Don’t miss out on the editor-approved SPF, which has also been linked to Lady Gaga, Maria Sharapova and Brooke Shields. Diptyque 4-Piece Candle Set This four-pack of star-approved Diptyque candles smells like shopping success. The Baies votive is said to have scented Meghan Markle and Prince Harry’s wedding, while Victoria Beckham made Figuier Vert the signature fragrance of her Dover store. “Everyone who walks in always talks about the amazing smell of the store, and that’s just because of the candle,” she told the Strategist. Dior Natural Glow Makeup Kit Adore Dior? Sample several of its favorites for less with this set, including the Diorshow mascara Drew Barrymore calls “the No. 1 in the biz.” La Mer Mini Miracles Soft Cream Set What do Scott Disick, Selena Gomez and Chrissy Teigen have in common? All three have name-dropped La Mer’s luxury skincare over the years, with Teigen once calling its renewal oil and signature creams the “three most important things in my skincare routine.” While the brand is hardly ever on sale, save over hundreds on exclusive kits like this starter set, plus the larger La Mer Radiant Renewal Set ($650 $415). Oribe Dry Texturizing Spray Duo While filming “Suits,” Meghan Markle told Beauty Banter her hairstylist used this texturizing spray to “add a little bounce” to her blowout. Westman Atelier The Summer Bronze Trio Celebrity makeup artist Gucci Westman’s worked with the likes of Jennifer Aniston, Anne Hathaway and Reese Witherspoon over the years. And her namesake makeup line is unsurprisingly a huge hit, with stars like Jennifer Garner singing its praises. We love this set, which comes with Westman Atelier’s Liquid Super Loaded Sheer Illuminator Drops in Peau de Soleil, Baby Cheeks Blush Stick in Dou Dou and Lit Up Highlight Stick in Nectar for a picture-perfect summer glow. NuFace Mini+ Smart On-the-Go Facial Toner Starter Kit NuFace’s toning devices are a hot commodity in Hollywood; Kim Cattrall used one to get ready for her buzzy “And Just Like That” cameo last year, while Kate Hudson praised the brand in a 2023 MindBodyGreen interview. “When I do the NuFace every day, I feel a huge difference in my skin,” she said. “I was not expecting that because I always think those things feel gimmicky, but they really work.” Elemis Pro-Collagen Cleansing Balm Much like its multihyphenate fans — who range from Bethenny Frankel to Catherine Zeta-Jones — this Elemis cleansing balm is an expert multitasker. It’s designed to remove makeup while simultaneously cleansing and hydrating the skin. Longchamp Le Pliage Cosmetics Case Who says beauty bags can’t be designer? Score a mini version of the celeb-loved Longchamp Le Pliage bag, perfect for stashing all your new beauty loot. Why Trust Page Six Style Shopping This article was written by Hannah Southwick, Commerce Writer/Reporter for Page Six Style. Hannah spies deals on actually affordable celebrity-worn styles, puts Hollywood’s favorite labels to the test and finds the beauty products that keep stars red carpet-ready. She consults stylists and industry pros — including celebs themselves — for firsthand product recommendations, trend predictions and more. In addition to writing for Page Six since 2020, her work has been featured in USA Today and Parade.

summary: Fashionistas did not "heart" this collection.
author: Brooke Kato
title: Designer slammed for 'I heart Ozempic' shirt: 'Toxic values'
text: Fashionistas did not “heart” this collection. Over the weekend at Berlin Fashion Week, provocative clubwear brand Namilia presented its Spring/Summer 2025 line, with an “I ‘heart’ Ozempic” shirt that triggered an uproar on social media over controversial couture. In a statement to The Post, Namilia’s co-creative director Nan Li said their critics are missing the point: The “I ‘heart’ Ozempic” tee is “a piece of pop art commentary and satire” targeting the health and beauty industry’s latest obsession with these controversial weight loss drugs. Namilia’s latest collection, titled “Good Girl Gone Bad,” highlighted society’s sordid obsession with celebrity gossip and paparazzi shots that dominated the culture of the early aughts, when ultra-thin was in among the Von Dutch era “It” girls. The brand debuted along with a collection of garments adorned with Ed Hardy designs, leather lace-up pants and mini skirts, barely-there one-pieces and a slew of slogan tees that read “fame kills” or “too pretty for rehab.” But in its attempt to be satirical with its abrasive Ozempic tank — a nod to the recent weight loss drug craze that has yielded nationwide shortages and a swell of rumors about which A-lister is taking the once-weekly jab — the label seems to have missed the mark among the masses. Critics on Instagram slammed Namilia for seemingly promoting eating disorders and unrealistic — and potentially damaging — beauty ideals. “This brand has become way too influential in the past couple of years to be spreading such low, superficial, capitalistic, and toxic values,” wrote one user in a lengthy diatribe. “‘Making a statement/joke’ and the statement is just ‘eating disorders are cool and fun and won’t ruin your life at all,'” sneered one critic. “SNOOZE.” “What a poor and distasteful joke. Such a shame,” commented another. “Your brand is incongruous,” one person wrote, criticizing the brand for sending a message of “pure patriarchy.” “How can you be ’empowering’ women by normalizing the use of a medicine that is scarce and that many people do need to live healthily?” “WTF….really? Are you promoting this?” someone else said in disbelief. Li told The Post he believes that “fashion is a visual tool for political and cultural statements” that can “provoke discussion” about the current culture. “The Ozempic craze for us has been played out in a double standard in pop culture,” Li said. “On one side celebrities and their followers are willing to do anything they can to fit the still prevalent super slim body ideal in pop culture but on the other side nobody is willing to admit to abusing medication to meet the often unrealistic expectations of current beauty standards.” Since the Ozempic boom, there has been a newfound cultural glorification of thinness as more celebrities are seemingly shrinking their silhouettes and those who cannot afford the costly prescription resort to knock-off medication and DIY hacks for budget weight loss. The semaglutide drug, which was initially manufactured for those with Type-2 diabetes, has also been reported to cause a wide array of side effects in users, such as eye conditions or a sunken face. Svelte frames were also en vogue during the heyday of indie sleaze and Y2K in the ’90s and ’00s, to which Namilia’s collection pays homage with Y2K trucker hats, shrunken, rhinestone-bedazzled baby tees and pink leopard print fabric. Trashy tramp stamps and belly button piercings are making a comeback, while “Brat Summer” — inspired by Charli xcx’s club album “Brat” and is defined “a pack of cigs, a Bic lighter and a strappy white top with no bra” — is gaining viral popularity among Gen Z, or self-proclaimed “brats.” “Namilia asks why pop culture pushes us to our breaking points for recognition, attention and some kind of belonging? Why does society desperately categorize us into stereotypes only to be disappointed when we fail to fully live up to these impossible standards?” the brand wrote on Instagram. “Why do we love to watch others fail?”

summary: Get ready to save in style.
author: Hannah Southwick
title: Shop our favorite celeb-inspired fashion finds at Nordstrom's Anniversary Sale
text: Get ready to save in style. When it comes to scoring designer labels for less, few savings events hold a candle to the Nordstrom Anniversary Sale — which kicked off on Tuesday for Icon cardholders and opens to the public on July 15. But with so many great finds on sale, from shoes to skincare, there’s no shortage of ways to fill your cart and closet. To get a head start on shopping, peruse our roundup of the best celeb-approved options below. Click to jump to a section: Women’s Clothing Shoes and Accessories Men’s Clothing Women’s Clothing Deals Spanx Booty Boost Active High Waist 7/8 Leggings Boost your workout wardrobe with new leggings from Spanx. Even Gwyneth Paltrow’s a fan of this particular pair, once raving on Instagram that she’s “weirdly very into” the brand’s activewear. Barefoot Dreams CozyChic Ultra Lite Knit Pajamas While stars like Khloé Kardashian and Hailey Bieber love Barefoot Dreams’ super soft blankets, these pajamas are just as cozy. Mother The Hustler Frayed Ankle Jeans Meghan Markle wore a pair of Mother jeans for her first-ever public appearance with Prince Harry in 2017. The label’s hardly lost steam in the years since, with other famous fans including Olivia Wilde, Jennifer Garner and “RHOBH” star Sutton Stracke. Max Mara Arona Double Face Wool Belted Coat Italian fashion house Max Mara is practically synonymous with standout outerwear like this chic wrap coat. From Kate Middleton to Angelina Jolie to Jennifer Lopez, plenty of stars have several such styles in their closets. Sweaty Betty Explorer T-Shirt Minidress Beat the heat with comfy T-shirt dresses like this majorly marked-down Sweaty Betty design. Veronica Beard Ennis Stretch Cotton Midi Dress Veronica Beard’s known for tailored, chic silhouettes, earning the brand celebrity fans ranging from Meghan Markle to Mandy Moore. We love this incredibly versatile LBD, which would work just as well at the office as for Sunday brunch. Soia & Kyo Alondra Asymmetric Jacket Markle’s also a fan of Soia & Kyo’s belted outerwear — and she’s in good company, as we’ve spotted everyone from Taylor Swift to Kerry Washington wearing the Canadian label’s distinctive designs. Wacoal Red Carpet Convertible Strapless Bra Celebrity stylist Kate Young spilled her red carpet styling secrets to Page Six Style in 2023, telling us her kit includes “strapless or convertible” styles like this aptly named bra. Beyond Yoga At Your Leisure Space Dye High Waist Midi Leggings Beyond Yoga makes some of celebrities’ favorite leggings — and judging by the customer reviews on this high-waisted style, it’s easy to see why. The design boasts over 390 largely positive reviews, praising it as “buttery soft” to “flattering.” Hanky Panky Original Rise Thong Long hailed as the purveyor of Jennifer Aniston’s favorite panties — after she name-checked the brand in a 2020 Interview magazine chat — Hanky Panky’s signature stretch thongs are a Hollywood staple. Farm Rio Palms Paradise Wrap Front Miniskirt We’ve spotted Farm Rio’s colorful patterned pieces everywhere from stars’ summertime Instagram snaps to Taylor Swift’s “Anti-Hero” music video. Women’s Shoe Deals Birkenstock Arizona Big Buckle Sandals Buckle up for great savings on stars’ favorite Birkenstock sandals, including this trendy take on the classic Arizona style. Ugg Discoquette Genuine Shearling Slide Slipper While summer’s still in full swing, it’s never too soon to get a great deal on cold-weather staples like these cozy — and rarely on-sale — Ugg slippers. Hoka Mach 5 Running Shoe Run, don’t walk to score deals on the Hoka running shoes celebrities can’t get enough of. New Balance 550 Basketball Sneaker Taylor Swift sported a pair of New Balance 550s for her first-ever appearance at a Kansas City Chiefs game. While this maroon-accented colorway is the closest to her red-and-white pair, versions with gray and green details are also on sale. Adidas Gazelle Bold Platform Sneaker It’s the prime time to (literally) elevate your sneaker game with platform Adidas like these Gazelles; the classic shoe is a favorite of stars like Harry Styles and Gigi Hadid. (Just be sure to scoop up your size fast, as deals this good usually don’t last the full length of the sale.) Stuart Weitzman Nudistcurve Ankle Strap Sandal Few heels feature on red carpets as often as Stuart Weitzman’s ubiquitous Nudist sandals. And while it’s rare to see the Hollywood favorite discounted, shoppers can pick up a pair for over $100 off right now. Mansur Gavriel Square Toe Mary Jane Ballet Flat While stars like Taylor Swift and Katie Holmes are obsessed with Mansur Gavriel’s bags, the brand makes equally trendy shoes like these eye-catching ballet flats, also on sale in black and gold. Stuart Weitzman Nolita Over-the-Knee Boots While you can’t buy Beyoncé’s sparkly Stuart Weitzman thigh-highs from the “Renaissance” tour, this over-$500-off pair is the next best thing. Accessories Celine Triomphe 52mm Oval Sunglasses While Kaia Gerber rocked these frames at a Celine show, you won’t need a fashion week invite to pick up the same pair for less. Béis Commuter Duffle Bag In 2022, Shay Mitchell told Page Six Style she wanted Béis to “be the go-to travel brand” — and in the time since, it’s become practically ubiquitous in airports and celebrity travel selfies alike. Score several Béis designs for less right now, including this spacious duffle with several zippered compartments. Monica Vinader Large Siren Muse Wave Hoop Earrings You won’t have to jump through hoops to score earrings from Monica Vinader, a go-to brand for both Kate Middleton and Meghan Markle. Jenny Bird Amelia Wrap Chain Necklace Jenny Bird’s bling is a hot commodity in Hollywood, popping up on everyone from Selena Gomez to Kylie Jenner. Bombas Assorted 3-Pack Tri-Block Ankle Socks From “Real Housewives of New York” star Jessel Taank to our own staffers, Bombas’ comfy cushioned socks are a hit with pretty much everyone. BaubleBar Shaken or Stirred Earrings Cheers to a great deal on these whimsical BaubleBar earrings, which Blake Lively wore while toasting to the start of 2024. Longchamp Large Le Pliage Tote In the three decades since it launched, Longchamp’s cult-favorite Le Pliage tote has earned legions of royal and celebrity admirers. (Kate Middleton even carried one at her college graduation.) “It’s a product that is so universal; everybody carries it,” Longchamp’s Global CEO, Jean Cassegrain, once told Page Six Style. JW Pei Joy Faux Leather Shoulder Bag JW Pei’s bags may be more budget-friendly than those from Chanel and Hermès, but they’ve nevertheless caught on with A-listers like Emily Ratajkowski and Selena Gomez. Madewell Medium Essentials Large Tote Bag While the Madewell carryall Meghan Markle and Gal Gadot have in common isn’t included in the deals, shop this versatile tote for a similar style. Men’s Clothing Barbour Barlow Quilted Vest Barbour’s weather-ready designs are a longtime favorite of members of the monarchy, having earned a coveted royal warrant. Brooks Brothers Advantage Flat Front Stretch Twill Chinos Still refreshing your workwear for a return to office? Score several Brooks Brothers styles for less right now. Nike Dri-Fit Victory+ Geo Print Golf Polo Snag a hole-in-one deal on Nike’s sweat-wicking styles, including this patterned golf polo. On Focus Athletic Shorts While it’s challenging to find a deals on Swiss label On — which provided several styles seen in summer blockbuster “Challengers” — Nordstrom has you covered with savings on both shoes and apparel. Stance Icon Assorted 3-Pack Crew Socks Looking for a red carpet-worthy deal? Jason Sudeikis sported the ultimate high-low look at the 2021 Emmy Awards, pairing a Tom Ford suit with comfy Stance socks. Tommy John 2-Pack Cool Cotton 6-Inch Boxer Briefs Bachelor Nation heartthrob Tyler Cameron once told us his date night essentials include “comfortable and breathable” underwear from Tommy John. summary: The White House communications team shared on X that President Joe Biden called Houston Mayor Whitmire and expressed his “condolences for the loss of life"
author: Kimberlee Speakman
title: At Least 8 Dead and More Than 2 Million Without Electricity After Hurricane Beryl Makes Landfall in U.S.
text: At least eight people are dead and over two million people are still without electricity after Hurricane Beryl made its way through Louisiana and Texas on Monday, July 8. Houston Mayor John Whitmire confirmed that at least three people have died as a result of the storm in a press conference, and several other county police departments in Texas have also confirmed deaths in their areas. Whitmire noted during his press conference that a man died due to a “tree falling” down on him, which “took his life,” and another person was killed in a “fire in southeast Houston,” which they believe may have been caused by “lightning” that was “storm-related.” He also noted that a “civilian employee” of Houston’s Police Department had been killed while “going to work” after he got stuck in “flood conditions” on Houston Avenue and floodwaters submerged his car. The Houston Police Department identified the deceased employee as information security officer Russell Richardson, 54, and asked people to keep his family and friends in their “prayers.” A constable in Harris County also confirmed on social media that a 74-year-old woman had died after a “tree fell through the roof” of her home. Meanwhile, the Bossier Parish Sheriff's Office in Louisiana confirmed on social media that a person “was killed after a tree fell on her house in northeast Benton.” Montgomery County Emergency Management also confirmed to CNN that three people had died, including one man in his 40s who was struck by a fallen tree while he was in his tractor in the eastern part of the county and two others who “were discovered in a tent in a wooded area in Magnolia.” Montgomery County Emergency Management did not immediately respond to PEOPLE’s request for comment. White House Deputy Communications Director Jennifer Molina shared on X (formerly Twitter) that President Joe Biden called Whitmire and expressed his “condolences for the loss of life as a result of Hurricane Beryl.” They also noted that Biden assured Whitmire that Texans would “have the resources they need to get through the storm now and to recover going forward.” Officials in the areas impacted by the storm also warn people to keep off roadways and stay away from downed power lines on Tuesday morning as “dangerous driving conditions still exist.” According to poweroutage.us, which tracks power outages across the country, more than 2.3 million people were without power in Texas as of 9 a.m. local time on Tuesday, July 9. Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer​​, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories. Other states also reported power outages due to the storm, including Louisiana, with 23,000 outages, and Arkansas, with over 18,000 outages. Beryl made landfall in the U.S. as a Category 1 hurricane before being downgraded to a tropical depression. However, a flood watch was issued for states from Arkansas to Michigan on July 9, with a possibility of up to 5 inches of rain, according to NBC News.

author: Hannah Southwick
title: Get Spanx, more of Oprah's 'Favorite Things' at the Nordstrom Anniversary Sale

So with the Nordstrom Anniversary Sale finally here — and hundreds of items discounted — why not take some shopping inspiration from her years’ worth of tried-and-true recommendations? While the major markdowns are currently only open to Nordstrom Icon cardholders, the brand’s Ambassador and Influencer-level members can start shopping on July 10 and 11, respectively, before deals open to the general public on July 15. Whether you’re already adding to cart or simply putting together a game plan, we’ve broken down the best deals from brands featured on Oprah’s “Favorite Things” lists over the years — from supportive shoes to shaping Spanx. Spanx The Perfect Ankle Tapered Ponte Pants When Page Six Style put these smoothing styles to the test, we found they truly lived up to their “perfect” branding. Oprah first raved about the Perfect Pant in 2019 — dubbing the original iteration “ultra flattering” and telling readers she even called up Spanx founder Sara Blakely to “applaud her” after slipping on a pair. “In sizes XS to 3X, they have built-in tummy control, so you don’t need to wear compression gear underneath — you’re already Spanxed!” she raved at the time. Dr. Barbara Sturm Glow Essentials Set Oprah’s skincare go-tos (or should we say, glow-tos?) include plenty of products from Dr. Barbara Sturm. After trying the brand — on a recommendation from fashion icon Stella McCartney, no less — she immediately became an investor. “I love it so much that I then called up Dr. Barbara Sturm, and said ‘I want to invest in your company,'” she said during a panel discussion, per Forbes. “And I have never done that before. Ever. So, that’s how good the products are.” Vionic Kimmie Perforated Suede Slip-On Sneaker The media icon has featured Vionic’s support-focused footwear on a whopping three “Favorite Things” lists over the years, highlighting a strikingly similar sneaker to this one in 2017. “Treat feet to these sneakers designed to hug arches and support natural alignment with an orthotic insert,” she raved at the time. Sunday Riley Jumbo Good Genes All-in-One Lactic Acid Treatment Score a good deal on the exfoliating Good Genes serum Oprah featured on her 2018 “Favorite Things” list as part of her “go-to beauty regimen.” Bravo star Paige DeSorbo is also a fan, raving in a recent Amazon livestream that she’s been using it for five years. While her exact favorites aren’t on sale, this comfy crewneck comes in the same breezy fabric she described as “like buttah.” Barefoot Dreams 2-Pack CozyChic Socks Treat your feet to cozy socks from Barefoot Dreams, which Oprah called “blissfully soft” in 2023. NYDJ Marilyn Straight Leg Jeans High denim prices giving you the blues? Score several on-sale styles from NYDJ, which Oprah called her “favorite denim brand” on her 2017 list. (She even attended the brow whiz’s star-studded birthday bash in 2023, alongside Kim Kardashian and Jennifer Lopez.) Save over $30 on the brand’s starter kit with this Nordstrom-exclusive deal. Kiehl’s Creme de Corps Body Moisturizer The former talk show host gave this cult-favorite moisturizer a shout-out on “Good Morning America” in 2012. She’s not the only one who loves Creme de Corps, as “RHONJ” star Melissa Gorga told us it’s her “absolute favorite.” Lunya Washable Silk Short Pajamas While the comfy Lunya pants from Oprah’s most recent “Favorite Things” list aren’t on sale, this silk PJ set is just as luxe. Barefoot Dreams CozyChic Short Robe Dreaming of a spa-like robe? Oprah’s also spotlighted Barefoot Dreams’ super-soft loungewear several times over the years. summary: Influencers are leading the way beyond brand endorsements.
author: Alana Sandel,Forbes Councils Member
title: From Lecturing To Inspiring Desire: Leveraging The Influencer Industry To Make Wellness Stick
text: Share to Facebook Share to Twitter Share to Linkedin Alana Sandel is a Chief Experience Officer at Marketing For Wellness, an agency committed to supporting brands that stand for well-being. getty Have you checked Instagram lately? Wellness and beauty sponsored posts may be overflowing your screen. From soul-searching courses and yoga exercises for your face to spirulina supplements, influencers are creating content to promote wellness that once took months to produce. New tools and gadgets have enabled influencers to bring products to life in mere minutes, making the once impossible seem effortless. Just as Edward Bernays, the founding father of PR, made smoking desirable by featuring gorgeous women smoking a cigarette, today, many influencers are inspiring people to rethink how they approach their health. With an estimated 129 million people in the U.S. having chronic health issues, influencers are making wellness messages desirable in many shapes and forms, like broadcasting from doctors' offices in real time while getting procedures. The wellness industry is set to grow from $5.6 trillion in 2023 to over $8 trillion globally by 2027, and influencers are at the forefront of this movement. Their ability to inspire a genuine desire for wellness, youthful looks, radiant skin and sustainability is moving the wellness industry from lecturing about wellness to inspiring consumers to want it. Create authentic relationships and campaigns with influencers. My company has been at the forefront of influencer marketing, and over the years, we learned that the most authentic campaigns are possible when an influencer is using a product and connects with a mission and values of the brand. MORE FOR YOU NYT ‘Strands’ Hints, Spangram And Answers For Tuesday, July 9th WWE Raw Results, Winners And Grades As Rhea Ripley Returns The Best Brewery In The U.S.—According To The U.S. Open Beer Championship Here is our checklist to identify the perfect match between the brands we represent and influencers we are looking for. • Consider values. Look for influencers whose values align with a brand. This means that the influencer will be passionate about sharing why they love the brand but also align themselves with the team behind the company, including community engagement and beyond. • It's about relationships. When you find your "golden influencers," nurture those relationships. Continuous engagement helps in creating trust and credibility. We enjoy collaborating with influencers over time—cooking classes and events of any kind where an influencer shows up and acts as a brand ambassador are great examples. • They got this. When the influencer understands your brand, they can contribute beyond authentic content. We appreciate the feedback our influencers bring to the table as a result of interactions with their followers about the brand. We channel this input back to our clients to give them valuable market research. Influencers can help people learn about and appreciate other cultures. Influencers are leading the way beyond brand endorsements. The trust they cultivate with their followers position them as an authority. For example, in 2016, we created a campaign for brands from Taiwan, and we extended the campaign by bringing to life a sustainable pop-up store in Seattle. The pop-up store would not have been a success without influencers, who bridged Taiwanese culture and transformed our pop-up store into a vibrant cultural experience. Through an evocative music performance by renowned musicians with international following and baking and bubble tea demos with a celebrity chef and best-selling author, visitors discovered and engaged with Taiwanese lifestyle products. When introducing new products to the U.S. market from other countries, consider following these tips. • Make it delicious. Conversations start at a dinner table, and so can discovery. We've found success pairing marketing of unfamiliar brands with culinary discoveries to introduce people to another culture through food and flavors. • Engage through stories. Use storytelling to connect cultural elements with the brand’s message. Influencers can share personal stories or travel experiences. • Include interactive elements. Incorporate interactive elements such as live demos or interactive exhibits to create immersive experiences. Consider influencers for roles as cause ambassadors. Charities are also embracing relationships with influencers to energize their communities and extend their voice to new members. A few years ago, we had the opportunity to collaborate with an organization bringing together thought leaders supporting the eradication of Polio. I experienced firsthand how a charitable cause can go viral with a campaign through storytelling. Influencers have important voices and can endorse and support a charitable cause by sharing their personal stories of how a charity played a big part in their lives. From fundraising to attracting volunteers, influencers can lead the way for your charity to create a meaningful impact and amplify your brand. Building trust for big and small brands requires three key elements. While listening to the giants of marketing at a conference in Miami, it became clear to me that whether you are managing any influencer marketing campaign or a med spa next door, it all comes down to the trust the influencer can evoke from their followers and back into your brand. The keys to building trust include: • Consistency: Ensure consistency in messaging and brand values across all influencer collaborations. • Transparency: Be transparent about your sponsorships and collaborations. Honesty builds credibility and trust with the audience. • Genuine endorsements: Work with influencers who genuinely use and believe in your product. Forced endorsements can be easily spotted and can damage trust. In influencers, we trust. Influencer marketing campaigns can drive higher conversion rates, with 37% of consumers trusting influencer recommendations over traditional advertising methods. Furthermore, businesses are experiencing a $5.2 ROI for every $1 invested in influencer marketing, and 86% of consumers have purchased a product online at least once a year after seeing it promoted by an influencer. Often, consumers are more likely to discover new products or brands through social media, making it a crucial platform for these initiatives. I have seen a transformation enabling niche startups in the wellness industry to launch brands in months and debut concepts at expos and trade shows. The speed to market and proof of concept is exponential, thanks to social media and influencers. Wellness is no longer a niche; it’s a movement, and influencers are a huge part of it, making hard work seem seamless as they get procedures done on the screen to get your attention, while thinking about the next soundtrack to appeal to all of your senses. Forbes Business Council is the foremost growth and networking organization for business owners and leaders. Do I qualify? Follow me on LinkedIn. Check out my website. Alana Sandel Editorial Standards Print Reprints & Permissions

summary: The Balmoral Hotel is a historical luxury hotel in the heart of Edinburgh. Here's a deep dive into what you need to know to decide whether you want to stay at this hotel.
author: Contributor,Robin Raven
title: The Balmoral Hotel Is A Historic Treasure In The Heart Of Edinburgh
text: Share to Facebook Share to Twitter Share to Linkedin The Balmoral Hotel is a historical landmark, literary legend, and luxury hotel in one. It began as a grand railway hotel called the North British Station Hotel in 1902 and has been called The Balmoral since 1988. Whether you're visiting for the popular afternoon tea at Palm Court or staying overnight as a guest, there is a lot to admire here. The Balmoral, a Rocco Forte Hotel, is a majestic and historical hotel located in the heart of ... [+] Edinburgh. The Balmoral, a Rocco Forte Hotel Hotel Overview Designed by William Hamilton Beattie and Andrew Robb Scott, who won a contest to design the prestigious hotel, the hotel has stunning Victorian architecture with distinct Scottish baronial style influences. Its turrets, balconies, and towers are as stunning as the attention to detail put into every aspect of the building. According to The Balmoral hotel website, “balmoral” in Gaelic translates to “majestic dwelling”. That certainly holds true for this five-star hotel in Edinburgh. Landmark Hotel In Edinburgh’s City Center Located in the heart of Scotland’s capital city at No 1 Princes Street, The Balmoral Edinburgh is near many of the most popular tourist spots. Beyond the luxury and comfort of the hotel, the convenient location is a big draw for many visitors. It's literally right by the Edinburgh Waverley railway station, the principal train station serving Edinburgh, Scotland. In fact, there's an entrance to the Waverley station just steps from the front door of the The Balmoral Hotel. The National Galleries of Scotland is only a seven-minute walk from The Balmoral Hotel. Other nearby things to do include visiting The Palace of Holyroodhouse, the official residence of His Majesty The King in Scotland. Hop-on, hop-off city tours are available nearby. The Edinburgh Castle, which can be seen from several of the suites at the hotel, is only a short drive away, too. It's also close to Author's Seat. The Balmoral is within walking distance to hundreds of shops. Once you step out the door on Princes Street, you are steps away from charming local shops, kilt maker storefronts, souvenir spots, and charity shops with uniquely Scottish merchandise. From restaurants focused on local, authentic Scottish fare to chains like Pizza Hut, a wide variety of eateries are near the hotel, too. MORE FOR YOU NYT ‘Strands’ Hints, Spangram And Answers For Tuesday, July 9th WWE Raw Results, Winners And Grades As Rhea Ripley Returns The Best Brewery In The U.S.—According To The U.S. Open Beer Championship The Clock Tower And Its History The Clock Tower of The Balmoral Hotel in Edinburgh, Scotland. getty The Balmoral's clock tower is one of the most easily recognized parts of the hotel. It always runs three minutes fast, except on New Year's Eve when it's set back to Greenwich Mean Time to help residents to enjoy the countdown to the New Year in real time. According to NPR, the only exception to that was in 2020 when they wished for three fewer minutes in a year marred by the pandemic. The Balmoral Hotel Edinburgh's Place In History and Pop Culture The Balmoral has been visited by some of the most famous people in the world. According to The Scotsman, Oprah Winfrey, Elizabeth Taylor, Beyoncé, Paul McCartney, Mick Jagger, Bill Clinton, Simon Cowell, and Anna Wintour are all among the celebrities who have stayed at The Balmoral Edinburgh. Tom Hanks resided here while making The Da Vinci Code. J.K. Rowling stayed at The Balmoral Hotel while she finished the Harry Potter series of books. She wrote the final chapters of the Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows book while staying in the suite that is now aptly called The J.K. Rowling Suite. (Yes, you can book a stay in the same suite and see if literary inspiration strikes for you, too.) The same desk where she wrote is still in the room, and the bust she signed when she finished the Harry Potter book series is there, too. Accommodations: Luxurious Rooms And Suites With Modern Amenities The Castle View suites at The Balmoral offer views of the Edinburgh Castle. The Balmoral, a Rocco Forte Hotel The Balmoral focuses on guest comfort and luxury in each room and suite. You'll notice that the rooms seamlessly match the overall upscale, traditional decor of the hotel, yet the hotel rooms offer modern furnishings and amenities. You can choose from these types of accommodations From Classic Rooms To Castle View Rooms As the most inexpensive accommodations at the luxury hotel, their classic rooms are elegant with art and decor that reminds you that you are in Scotland. With an average of 25 square meters per room, the executive rooms are spacious and relaxing. The decor and art on the walls in this room type are inspired by Scotland. Several other types of rooms are available, with the deluxe castle view rooms being popular with their amazing views of Edinburgh Castle and decor that's reminiscent of the Scottish countryside. The family room is a popular choice for groups traveling together; they can book two adjoining executive view rooms to enjoy time together while still maintaining privacy for sleeping. One-Of-A-Kind Hotel Suites The Bowes-Lyon Suite is a special suite at The Balmoral. The Balmoral, a Rocco Forte Hotel The suites at The Balmoral are large and perfectly blend contemporary and heritage decor. The classic suites range from 44 to 66 square meters. The grand suites range from 51 to 55 square meters, and they are named Stirling, Dunrobin, Braemar, and Tay. Many suites have views of Edinburgh Castle and other historical sites in the city. The J.K. Rowling Suite at The Balmoral Edinburgh is very popular among Harry Potter fans. The Balmoral, a Rocco Forte Hotel Then there are the Forte suites. You can book a stay at the famous J.K. Rowling Suite and write at the same place the author finished the mega-successful Harry Potter book series; in addition to its known history, you can find small touches to remind you of the books throughout the suite. The Glamis Suite is named after The Queen Mother's childhood home and does feel like staying in a castle. Other suites available include the Bowes-Lyon Suite and the Balmoral Suite. Family-Friendly Amenities And Services Families are welcomed with open arms at The Balmoral hotel. There's even a mascot for kids called Bonnie, a baby owl who is noted to be always on time since legend has it that she lives in the clock tower of the hotel. Children get their own owl teddy turn down service, and parents can book babysitting services 24 hours per day. Kids will love their own luxurious bath robe and slippers, too. Your hotel can be prepared for children of all ages. It can be set up with baby cots and baby bed linens. Baby meals are complimentary. Anything you may need for young children such as bibs, baby crockery, temperature testers, high chairs, bottle warmers, baby baths, and more are available by request. Amenities For Guests Of The Balmoral Thoughtful amenities in all guest rooms include bathrobes and adult slippers is two sizes, A free bottle of Scottish mineral water is provided for guests, something that can be especially welcome after a long travel day. There's an in-room bar and safe. A vanity mirror on the desk means it can double as both a work desk and a vanity. The gorgeous Italian marble bathrooms are well-stocked with Irene Forte skin care products. Rooms and suites have a smart television with interactive entertainment, and they have a power point with a USB charger and international power adapter. Accessible Accommodations The Balmoral is accessible for all guests. They will happily accommodate special requests, and entrances are marked when they are preferable over others for disabled access. If you need a scooter or mobility device, the elevators and accommodations are well-equipped to handle them, and the valet can help coordinate things like the delivery of mobility devices. Enhanced Vacations At The Balmoral As a five-star luxury hotel, The Balmoral has a strong focus on going the extra mile to help guests make the most of their time in Edinburgh. Sure, there's plenty to do with the hotel's convenient location on Princes Street being right by so many shops and historical attractions. However, if you have a focus or special experiences. you want to have, talk to the hotel's concierge. Here are some of the special packages and experiences they can prepare for your stay. The Balmoral Land, Loch, and Sky Experience The Land, Loch, and Sky Experience honors The Balmoral's integral connections to Scotland by providing a four-day experience that showcases the wonders of the country by land, loch, and sky! With this package, guests can stay at the ultra-posh presidential suite, the Scone & Crombie, and they will have the opportunity to enjoy special experiences such as visiting Glamis Castle, going on a luxury yacht at Loch Lomond, marveling at a private helicopter tour to Skye, and taking a private royal tour of Edinburgh, among other experiences. The Golf Experience For Balmoral Hotel Guests Beyond providing a five-star hotel experience, The Balmoral Hotel Edinburgh can help you plan your ideal experiences for your Scotland vacation. Since Scotland is well-known for its world-class golfing, the hotel has a Balmoral Golf Experience that can provide access to some of the most exclusive golf courses and clubs in Scotland. Dining Experiences And The Scotch Bar Brasserie Prince: upscale dining with a French twist The Brasserie Prince has a vegan-friendly menu. The Balmoral, a Rocco Forte Hotel The hotel has five different restaurants, including the Michelin-starred Number One, but the Brasserie Prince really stands out. It serves breakfast, lunch, and dinner. It has a vegan-friendly menu. In fact, there's even a vegan burger on the menu which you may not expect to find at such an upscale eatery, yet you shouldn't miss it. The chef can also accommodate the needs of those with many dietary restrictions and allergies. The Balmoral, a Rocco Forte Hotel, serves afternoon tea at the Palm Court. The Balmoral, a Rocco Forte Hotel A traditional, award-winning afternoon tea is served at the Palm Court tea room. If you prefer relaxing in privacy while dining in your room or suite, room service is available 24 hours per day. The Scotch Bar Offers The Horizon Whisky Experience The Scotch Bar is a haven for whiskey lovers. (Keep in mind that whiskey is spelled “whisky” in Scotland.) It has over 500 different and distinct types of Scottish whiskey, making it one of the biggest and varied collections of whiskey in Edinburgh. Their whiskey comes from all over the country including distilleries in the Highlands and the Islands. The Scotch Bar has over 500 Scottish whiskey varieties. The Balmoral, a Rocco Forte Hotel The Balmoral has recently started offering an exclusive £100,000 Horizon Whisky Experience to interested guests. They are working in partnership with The Macallan and Bentley Motors to offer this opportunity. As the first hotel in Scotland to secure The Macallan Horizon whiskey bottle, The Balmoral created The Horizon Whisky Experience to allow whiskey lovers to have a vacation that is focused on the pleasures of this passion in way they won't forget. This special experience at The Balmoral is ideal for whiskey lovers. The Balmoral, a Rocco Forte Hotel When guests book The Horizon Whisky Experience, they can stay in The Balmoral's Scone & Crombie presidential suite and enjoy a night's stay in Speyside. It includes a bottle of the limited edition The Macallan Horizon and a personal membership to the hotel's exclusive SCOTCH Club. Also included is a private, chauffeur-driven guided tour of The Macallan Estate, and guests will be treated to a private tasting session and a special meal in The Macallan Distillery. Exceptional Service Outstanding Guest Relations And Personalized Service One of the things that The Balmoral is known for is the high quality of its service. The five-star staff do little things like make sure vegans will have plant-based milks and other things they may need, and they provide special touches to delight children and make them feel excited to be staying there. The great and knowledgable staff can help with everything from directions to tourist attractions to recommending the best way to access the train station next door to the hotel. A dedicated, exceedingly kind concierge team can make reservations or arrange nearly any experience you wish to have in Edinburgh. If it's raining at or near the hotel, they will greet you with an umbrella so that you stay dry when exploring Princes Street and beyond. Facilities and Amenities State-Of-The-Art Fitness Center And Spa Facilities The Balmoral Spa is an integral part of this excellent property. It is focused on enrichment of physical, mental, emotional, and spiritual help. It has a lap pool with a poolside refreshment area, a Turkish steam room, and Finnish sauna. It has a group exercise studio and a Technogym-equipped gym, so you can enjoy a workout and then relax in the steam room. Treatments available at the spa include facials and wide variety of massages. If you want to make an afternoon of it, you can book a spa and lunch package that will include a massage, a two-course lunch, and access to the spa facilities such as the steam room and sauna. Practical Information Check-In And Check-Out Policies The check in time at The Balmoral is 3:00 p.m., although it will vary depending on what the hotel currently has available. If they can accommodate an earlier check-in, the friendly staff will do so. If you arrive before the check-in time and your room isn't ready, the staff will offer to store your luggage and let you know when the room is ready. The check-out time is noon. If you need to stay later in the day, it's suggested that you book the hotel for an additional night so that you have access to your room as long as you need. Alternately, you can have the hotel store your luggage while you explore the city, enjoy a meal at one of the hotel restaurants, or enjoy a treatment at the spa. Parking And Transportation Options At The Balmoral A valet car parking service is available at The Balmoral. A doorman will greet you upon arrival, and they will take care of parking your car. Since you are a guest, you will be given a parking space and don't need to pre-book this. If you didn't bring a car, exploring the city is still easy. There are public transportation options just steps from the hotel, and you can take a train easily from Waverley Station which is next door to the hotel. The Balmoral Hotel Experience - Conclusion The Balmoral, a Rocco Forte Hotel, is a wonderful and luxurious place to stay. The Balmoral, a Rocco Forte Hotel Ultimately, if you can afford a stay at The Balmoral hotel, it is a special way to experience and take in the remarkable history of Edinburgh and enjoy all the comforts of a luxurious home. It's a wonderful hotel with a fascinating history and stunning architecture, and its location near the lively Princes Street means that you are staying right in the heart of the city. Follow me on Twitter or LinkedIn. Robin Raven Following Editorial Standards Print Reprints & Permissions

summary: Nordstrom's home to some of the best decor deals on the internet right now.
author: Hannah Southwick
title: Nordstrom's best Anniversary Sale home decor deals: 8 celeb-approved picks
text: With the Nordstrom Anniversary Sale finally here, the retailer is home to some of the biggest bargains around. And in addition to can’t-miss fashion and beauty exclusives, Nordstrom is also discounting home decor and kitchen products from the likes of Barefoot Dreams and Le Creuset. Below, we’ve cooked up a few top picks stars swear by — from super-soft blankets to the candles that get Bravo stars all fired up. (Just note that while deals are already open for Icon cardholders — and will open to Ambassadors and Influencers on July 9 and 10, respectively — the sale unlocks for the general public on July 15.) Barefoot Dreams In the Wild Blanket Plenty of stars are dreaming about these cuddly blankets — including Hailey Bieber, who spotlighted one on her holiday gift guide in 2022. Khloé Kardashian also raved over her throw in a PopSugar interview earlier this year, calling it a “nonnegotiable” when traveling. “They’re soft and big enough that you can use it as a pillow or like a body pillow to snuggle with,” she added. Le Creuset Enameled Cast Iron Brazier Le Creuset makes some of the most luxe kitchen goods on the market. Just ask Lisa Vanderpump, who called the sought-after brand “the Rolls-Royce of cookware” in a Page Six Style interview. Diptyque 4-Piece Candle Gift Set When it comes to racking up A-list fans, Diptyque’s candles are quite literally on fire. Meghan Markle is said to have used the Baies version to scent her wedding to Prince Harry, while Victoria Beckham selected Figuier as her store’s signature fragrance. summary:
Indian prime minister travelled to Moscow for two-day summit and ‘chit-chat’ amid diplomatic complexities

  • Russia-Ukraine war – latest news updates

As India’s prime minister, Narendra Modi, landed in Moscow on Monday, it was straight into the warm embrace of Vladimir Putin.
